clarification.important: ALTITUDE ROTATION IS WOMEN'S TENNIS ONLY
clarification.universalSystems: Travel partners and pods apply to WTN, MBB, WBB
clarification.sportSpecific: Altitude rotation is unique to Women's Tennis format

universal.description: Systems used across WTN, MBB, WBB

womensTennisOnly.rationale: WTN format and competition structure requires special altitude considerations

travelPartners.description: Same 8 travel partner pairs used across WTN, MBB, WBB

podSystem.description: Same 4-pod structure (4 teams each) across WTN, MBB, WBB
podSystem.coverage: All teams must play pod opponents

altitudeRotation.cycle: 4-year rotation for non-altitude pairs visiting altitude
altitudeRotation.description: Ensures all non-altitude pairs experience altitude conditions equally
altitudeRotation.note: THIS SYSTEM IS WOMEN'S TENNIS ONLY - not used in MBB/WBB

altitudeTeams.consideration: Special scheduling to avoid both altitude pairs in same season

scheduleFormat.description: Each team plays 13 of 15 possible opponents

universalElements.pods: Identical 4-pod structure across all three sports

coordinationOpportunities.sharedWeekends: Coordinate travel partner weekends across sports

limitations.altitudeRotation: Women's Tennis specific - cannot be applied to MBB/WBB
limitations.seasonTiming: Different seasons prevent direct schedule coordination
limitations.formatDifferences: Game counts and structures vary significantly

recommendations.recommendation: Maximize Baylor-TCU partnership utilization across all three sports
recommendations.rationale: 95% travel reduction potential (same metro area) applies universally
recommendations.implementation: Coordinate weekend scheduling across WTN, MBB, WBB for shared travel
recommendations.impact: Significant cost savings for DFW-area athletic programs

recommendations.recommendation: Optimize pod-based scheduling consistency across sports
recommendations.rationale: 87.6% pod efficiency with identical structure across sports
recommendations.implementation: Ensure all sports prioritize pod opponent coverage
recommendations.impact: Simplified logistics and improved competitive balance

recommendations.rationale: 85% efficiency with room for improvement in fairness
recommendations.implementation: Adjust rotation order considering pod geography and competitive balance
recommendations.impact: More equitable altitude exposure - WTN specific benefit
recommendations.note: Does NOT apply to MBB/WBB - they have different altitude considerations

recommendations.recommendation: Implement unified travel partner weekend coordination
recommendations.rationale: Same partner pairs used across sports with 95% compatibility
recommendations.implementation: Create shared calendar for partner weekend scheduling
recommendations.impact: Reduced conflicts and improved athletic department coordination

recommendations.recommendation: Respect sport-specific systems while maximizing universal benefits
recommendations.rationale: Altitude rotation is WTN-only; other sports have different optimal patterns
recommendations.implementation: Apply universal systems (partners/pods) while preserving sport-specific elements
recommendations.impact: Optimal scheduling for each sport without forcing incompatible systems

recommendations.rationale: Different sports have different altitude, timing, and format constraints
recommendations.implementation: Build constraint system that understands sport-specific vs universal rules
recommendations.impact: Accurate scheduling without inappropriate constraint application

metadata.correctionNote: Altitude rotation system corrected to Women's Tennis only
